step2.ptxt: If even a thin film of oil is left on the surface of the halogen light, its service life will be shortened because the light will burn at a higher temperature.
Handle halogen lights with great care. Dropping, hitting or damaging the bulb in any way may cause it to explode or shatter because of its high internal pressure.
Always prepare a new bulb for replacement. While replacing the bulb, the lens may attract dust and moisture if the bulb is removed from the vehicle for too long.
Always use a bulb of the same wattage for replacement.
Firmly reinstall the socket after bulb replacement. Moisture or water may enter the light cavity if there are gaps around the socket.
